Title:
Two new species of Pucciniastrum producing dimorphic sori and
spores from northeast of China
Keywords:
Aster, Galium; Kalimeris; Morphology; Phylogeny;
Pucciniales; Pucciniastrum; Rust fungus
Abstract:
During field surveys for rust fungi, northeast of China,
rust specimens on Galium (Rubiaceae), Aster and Kalimeris (Compositae)
were found in Jilin and Heilongjiang Provinces. Comparative morphology
and phylogenetic analyses with 28S and ITS regions of rDNA showed that
these specimens belong to Pucciniastrum, although no telial stage was
found and they were different to Pucciniastrum species previously
reported from the same host genera. Therefore, the rust fungus on Galium
and another on Aster and Kalimeris are described as P. coronisporum, and
P. verruculosum, respectively. Both new species are mainly characterized
by having two types of uredinia producing morphologically different
urediniospores, which are intermingled in most of the uredinia.
Pucciniastrum coronisporum has echinulate and coronate urediniospores,
while those of P. verruculosum are echinulate and verrucose to
nail-headed.
